com.nv.security
Class UserSecurityManager

java.lang.Object
  com.nv.security.UserSecurityManager

public class UserSecurityManager
extends java.lang.Object

Employes the Singleton design pattern to manage an instance of the SecurityToken.

The security token represents an authenticated user and is used to gain access to various resources pertaining to the Launch Pad application.

Author:
rterrell

Constructor Summary
UserSecurityManager()
          Create a SecurityUtil object containing an uninitialized user security token.

Method Detail

getSecurityToken

public static final SecurityToken getSecurityToken()
Return the user's security token.

Returns:
an instance of iBatis' SqlMapClient. Null is returned if the iBatis environment has not bee intialized.

initUserSecurity

public static final void initUserSecurity()
                                   throws UserSecurityException
The purpose of this method is to setup the security token and to initialize and assoicate a common database connection with the token.

The security token is not linked with a user at this point. Once the token is successfully created, a connection to RF database is opend and made available to the entire application via the security token.

Throws:
UserSecurityException - database access error

updateSecurityToken

public void updateSecurityToken(Assoc user)
Updates the security token with the valid user with administrative access rights

Parameters:
user -

resetSecurityToken

public void resetSecurityToken()
Removes the user from the security token signaling that there is no one logged into the system.

setServer

public void setServer(java.lang.String server)
Adds server to the security token.

Parameters:
server - the server to set
